alert.note: Alert for Calloway; Christian; Livingston; Lyon; Marshall; Trigg (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 11:46PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Calloway, southern Crittenden, southeastern Livingston, western Christian, Caldwell, Marshall, Trigg, southern Hopkins and Lyon Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1043 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms from Fredonia to Murray. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Eddyville and Creswell around 1050 PM CDT. Cravens Bay Campground, Woodlands Nature Station, Energy Lake Campground and Farmersville around 1055 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Olney, Dawson Springs, Cadiz, Cobb, Madisonville, Earlington, Nortonville and Mortons Gap. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 21 and 75. Interstate 69 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 37 and 113. Western Kentucky Parkway near Mile Marker 39. Pennyrile Parkway between Mile Markers 27 and 34. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for western Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Calloway; Christian; Livingston; Lyon; Marshall; Trigg
